description.value:
At 2nd level, you've created a @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-items.aZpcmTM2YZKEencp]{Star Chart} as part of your heavenly studies. It is a Tiny object and can serve as a spellcasting focus for your druid spells. You determine its form by rolling on the Star Map table or by choosing one.

While holding this map, you have these benefits:

  • You know the @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.dE67aeShIRELgRuX]{Guidance} cantrip.
  • You have the @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.Evg5576HST04iNJU]{Guiding Bolt} spell prepared. It counts as a druid spell for you, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can have prepared.
  • You can cast @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.Evg5576HST04iNJU]{Guiding Bolt} without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the map, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to magically create a replacement. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous map.

It's recommended to add Guiding Bolt to your character twice; one with Preparation Mode set to Always Prepared, and the other with Preparation Mode set to Innate Spellcasting with @prof uses per Long Rest.
